items.title: Source: Chargers' Tart fined for slapping Kelce
items.summary: Chargers defensive tackle Teair Tart has been fined by the NFL for slapping Chiefs tight end Travis Kelce in their Week 1 game, a source told ESPN.

items.title: Indianapolis Colts Injury Report: Week 2
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts today released their Friday injury report for Week 2 of the NFL season ahead of their Sunday game against the Denver Broncos. Cornerback Charvarius Ward had been ruled OUT for Sunday’s game against the Broncos with a concussion. Ward appeared in the injury report early in the week after being placed into […]

items.title: Is Last Week’s Playbook This Week’s Answer?
items.summary: If you can’t bask and dream after a performance like last week’s, you may be more interested in being proven right, than being a die-hard Colt fan.  You still may end up being right, as it is hard to imagine looking better next week, but what would your opinion be with a less aesthetic win?  […]

items.title: Report: Colts work out six players on Friday
items.summary: According to KPRC2’s Aaron Wilson, the Indianapolis Colts worked out six players on Friday afternoon, including former Miami Dolphins’ 2017 2nd round pick Raekwon McMillan: The 29-year-old linebacker appears to be the most recognizable name on this list, recording 285 tackles (172 solo), 4 passes defensed, 3 forced fumbles, and 2 fumble recoveries during 72 career games (37 starts) […]

items.title: Colts cornerbacks Charvarius Ward, Jaylon Jones ruled out for Sunday’s game against Broncos
items.summary: The secondary is already getting thin for the Indianapolis Colts, who may be forced to deploy another unfamiliar cornerback trio in Sunday’s Week 2 matchup against the Denver Broncos. The “White Out” redemption game at Lucas Oil Stadium features the classic unstoppable force versus an immovable unit. If the instability at quarterback was alarming enough […]

items.title: Colts CBs Charvarius Ward, Jaylon Jones out vs. Denver; DE Laiatu Latu questionable
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Indianapolis Colts defense will be shorthanded when it attempts to build on its season-opening dominance. Cornerbacks Charvarius Ward (concussion) and Jaylon Jones (hamstring) have been ruled out of Sunday’s meeting with the Denver Broncos at Lucas Oil Stadium, and defensive end Laiatu Latu (hamstring) is questionable. Ward is out until he passes [...]

items.title: Colts rule out CB Jaylon Jones, CB Charvarius Ward Sr. for Week 2 game vs. Denver Broncos
items.summary: Ward (concussion) did not participate in practice this week.

items.title: 'Yeah, this guy is a gamer': Vikings not surprised by J.J. McCarthy's eye-opening NFL debut

items.title: Colts’ Matchups to Watch: Week 2 vs. Broncos

items.title: Three keys to victory for the Colts against the Broncos
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts are 1-0 after week one. That sentence has been in the works for a long time, but it is finally here. Now is the time for the Colts to build on their new found momentum to start a season and beat the Denver Broncos at home. The Broncos are coming off a […]

items.title: Colts vs. Broncos preview: Shane Steichen, Daniel Jones face stiff challenge against Vance Joseph, Pat Surtain II and Denver defense
items.summary: The Colts won their season opener for the first time since 2013, but quickly moved past their 33-8 thumping of the Dolphins to prepare for the challenge of facing the Broncos, who made the playoffs in 2024.

items.title: Week 1 Colts Defensive Rankings and Analysis:
items.summary: Each week during the season, I will be walking through the data from the previous Colts game and analyzing the numbers to form a sort of “what happened” narrative, as well as comparing the Colts against all other teams in the league. For a glossary of the stats listed, reference Season Stats. Thanks to Pro Football Reference, NFL.com, Football Outsiders, […]

items.title: Colts among 162 Senior candidates for Pro Football Hall of Fame
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Several Colts – Baltimore and Indy editions – are among 162 players nominated for the Pro Football Hall of Fame’s Class of 2025 as Seniors. Senior candidates could have last appeared in a game in 2000. Players who spent the bulk of their career, or just a year or two, with the Colts [...]

items.title: Adding Tyler Warren to the Colts’ offensive mix means ‘less balls’ for receivers
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — Reggie Wayne has experienced this Tyler Warren Effect before. In the early 2000s, he and Marvin Harrison were a prolific tandem for Peyton Manning. They were the driving forces behind the Indianapolis Colts' offense. “It was me and Marv on the outside and we’re fightin’ for action,’’ Wayne said Thursday. But things were [...]

items.title: Practice notebook: Colts' cornerback depth comes into focus with Charvarius Ward Sr. in concussion protocol, Jaylon Jones out
items.summary: Neither Ward nor Jones practiced Thursday – head coach Shane Steichen said Jones would be out for a while – meaning the Colts may lean on three newcomers at corner to step in for Sunday's game against the Denver Broncos.

Plus: injury concerns in the secondary, Daniel Jones' command at the line of scrimmage, the impact of [...]

items.title: Tyler Warren makes strong first impression with Colts
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The first step was impressive. In fact, almost historic. “It was a good start,’’ Tyler Warren said of his debut as the tight end the Indianapolis Colts have been missing. Daniel Jones agreed. His first pass – the first offensive play dialed up – in Sunday’s 33-8 demolition of the Miami Dolphins was [...]

items.title: 9 years into NFL career, Kenny Moore II is still building his legacy
items.summary: Kenny Moore II, as a 16-year-old, quit football. He was coaxed back a day later. Over a decade later, he's still playing, and still has plenty more to accomplish.

items.title: Colts face cornerback concerns after opening win
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – Breaking the NFL’s longest active non-winning streak in season openers came at a price for the Indianapolis Colts. Colts Head Coach Shane Steichen said Wednesday that starting cornerback Charvarius Ward is in the league’s concussion protocol and backup Jaylon Jones “will be out for a while’’ with a hamstring injury. Both were injured [...]

items.title: Colts notebook: Practice squad moves, Sunday ‘White Out’
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS – The Indianapolis Colts signed a pair of defensive backs to the practice squad this week. The team added cornerback Keydrain Calligan and safety Darrick Forrest. The Colts are in need of help in the secondary after Jaylon Jones suffered a hamstring injury that will likely keep him out for a few weeks. Charvarius [...]

items.title: Colts beat Dolphins for first season-opening win since 2013
items.summary: INDIANAPOLIS — The Colts honored late owner Jim Irsay the best way they could — with a win. They dominated the Miami Dolphins, 33-8, in the season-opener Sunday afternoon at Lucas Oil Stadium. The win is their first in week 1 since quarterback Andrew Luck led them to victory against the Oakland Raiders in 2013. [...]

items.title: Colts Blue Zone Podcast 422: Streak Busters! Colts Top Dolphins in Season Opener
items.summary: The Indianapolis Colts put together a complete performance in Week 1 to snap their streak of futility in season openers. Standout performances from Daniel Jones, Tyler Warren and multiple defenders highlighted the 33-8 win. In this episode of the Colts Blue Zone Podcast, we look back at the game and how the team honored late [...]

items.summary: The Colts had three sacks and two interceptions in their 33-8 win over the Dolphins on Sunday.

items.title: 'Win For Jim' mantra inspires Colts in Week 1 win: 'We're playing for a bigger purpose'

items.title: How Daniel Jones, Shane Steichen and the Colts' offense threw a near-perfect game in Week 1 blowout win over Dolphins
items.summary: The Colts became the first team since 1977 to score on all seven of their possessions in their 33-8 trouncing of the Miami Dolphins on Sunday at Lucas Oil Stadium.

items.title: Colts dominate Dolphins, win first season opener in 11 years
items.summary: Daniel Jones was 22-of-29 for 272 yards and a touchdown, with two rushing touchdowns of his own, in the Colts' 33-8 win.
